title: Photos released of suspect who allegedly blew up ATM in Woburn
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Masked suspect allegedly detonated an explosive device at a Woburn ATM on Mishawum Road early Thursday morning.
Surveillance images show the suspect wearing a blue mask and dark clothing; the FBI released the photos on Friday.
Authorities report no injuries from the explosion and urge anyone with information to contact Woburn Police or the FBI.

title: 10 bold predictions for the 2025 Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye is expected to lead the Patriots' offense with 30 total touchdowns, despite a challenging offensive line.
Running back TreVeyon Henderson is predicted to surpass 1,000 rushing yards, becoming a key player in the Patriots' offense.
The Patriots anticipate missing the playoffs with an 8-9 record, despite roster changes and new head coach Mike Vrabel.

title: Tom Brady ‘was supposed’ to play for Raiders upon leaving Patriots, Las Vegas owner Mark Davis said
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady was close to joining the Las Vegas Raiders in 2020 but the team chose a different direction.
Brady eventually became a minority owner of the Raiders in May 2023, after retiring from the NFL.
The NFL amended rules allowing Brady to attend production meetings as FOX's NFL commentator with restrictions.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Friendship' featuring Tim Robinson and Paul Rudd is now streaming on HBO Max.
Spike Lee's 'Highest 2 Lowest' with Denzel Washington is available on Apple TV+.
'The Great British Baking Show' season 16 is currently streaming on Netflix.

title: What Jakobi Meyers and the Raiders are saying about the Patriots ahead of season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers and Pete Carroll return to Foxborough as Raiders prepare to face Patriots without Bill Belichick.
Patriots' new era under coach Mike Vrabel begins against former coach Pete Carroll now leading the Raiders.
Raiders wide receiver Jakobi Meyers balances excitement and professionalism facing his former team, the Patriots.

title: Jaylen Brown gives his own take on Boston Tea Party in stream with IShowSpeed
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown and YouTuber IShowSpeed streamed a Boston tour featuring a playful Boston Tea Party reenactment.
Brown and IShowSpeed participated in activities like Muay Thai and a race challenge around Downtown Crossing.
Brown humorously contested IShowSpeed's race victory on social media after a close finish and hamstring injury.

title: Dante Scarnecchia likes what he sees from Patriots rookie Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell, the Patriots' No. 4 pick, is set to debut against the Raiders despite an ankle injury.
Dante Scarnecchia praises Campbell's dynamic run blocking and improved technique despite arm length concerns.
Campbell received high grades for pass and run blocking during preseason, but challenges await against NFL competition.

title: ‘That’s their prerogative’: Mike Vrabel responds to Bill Belichick’s ban on Patriots scouts at UNC
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: UNC coach Bill Belichick banned New England Patriots scouts from attending practice and games at the university.
Mike Vrabel, Patriots' coach, expressed focus on his team and plans to find other ways to scout UNC players.
Belichick's ban follows his departure from Patriots and strained relations with owner Robert Kraft after his firing.

title: Woman who was allegedly filmed in the shower at URI is suing the school
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A University of Rhode Island student, 'Jane Doe', sues the school alleging she was filmed in a unisex shower.
Jane Doe's lawsuit claims URI was negligent with bathroom security and defamed her after the incident.
James Paquette, identified in the police lineup, faces a state-level video voyeurism charge for the incident.

title: Christian Gonzalez to miss Patriots’ season opener, Will Campbell questionable vs. Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Cornerback Christian Gonzalez out for Patriots' opener against Raiders due to an ongoing hamstring injury since July 28.
Rookie left tackle Will Campbell listed as questionable with an ankle injury ahead of the Patriots' game on Sunday.
Raiders to test Patriots' revamped secondary with new head coach Pete Carroll and quarterback Geno Smith.
